title.narrative: Integrated Risk Management in the Rural Agroindustrial System

description.narrative: The objective of the project is to improve the management of agricultural risks by eligible beneficiaries and selected public institutions.

condition.narrative: Loan Agreement, Institutional Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.G. A manual (“CERC Manual”) is prepared and adopted in form andsubstance acceptable to the Bank.
Loan Agreement, Institutional Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.G. An Emergency Action Plan is prepared and adopted in form andsubstance acceptable to the Bank.
Loan Agreement, Institutional Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.G. The Emergency Response Part is carried out in accordance withthe CERC Manual and the Emergency Action Plan.

Loan Agreement, Institutional Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.G. The environmental and social instruments required for theContingent Emergency Response Part are prepared, disclosed and adopted in accordance with the CERC Manual and the ESCP, and in formand substance acceptable to the Bank.

Loan Agreement, Schedule 2, Section III.B.1 (b). No withdrawals shall be made for Emergency Expenditures under Category (8),unless and until all of the following conditions have been met in respect of said expenditures: (A) the Borrower has determinedthat an Eligible Crisis or Emergency has occurred, and has furnished to the Bank a request to withdraw Loan amounts under Category(8)

Loan Agreement, Schedule 2, Section III.B.1 (b). No withdrawals shall be made for Emergency Expenditures under Category (8),unless and until all of the following conditions have been met in respect of said expenditures: (B) the Bank has agreed with suchdetermination, accepted said request, and notified the Borrower thereof.

Loan Agreement, Schedule 2, Section III.B.1 (b). No withdrawals shall be made for Emergency Expenditures under Category (8),unless and until all of the following conditions have been met in respect of said expenditures: the Borrower has adopted the CERCManual and Emergency Action Plan, in form and substance acceptable to the Bank.

Loan Agreement, Schedule 2, Section III.B.1 (b). No withdrawals shall be made for Emergency Expenditures under Category (8),unless and until all of the following conditions have been met in respect of said expenditures: the Borrower has prepared,disclosed, and adopted, the environmental and social instruments required for the Contingency Emergency Response Part, acceptableto the Bank.

Loan Agreement: Cooperation Agreements (Schedule 2, Section I.D). Description: The Borrower shall, through MAI’s DGPPSE, not laterthan four months after the Signature Date with respect to INTA, CONAE, and SMN, and prior to initiating any activities for thestrengthening of the agroclimatic and price information systems operating in the Borrower’s territory and involving the cooperationof other Selected Public Institutions, enter into a cooperation agreement with INTA, CONAE SMN and the respective Selected PublicInstitution, in terms substantially similar to those in the Model Form of Cooperation Agreement and acceptable to the Bank, settingforth their respective responsibilities in the implementation of such activities.

Loan Agreement: Component 2 (Schedule 2, Section I.C (a)). The Borrower shall, prior to the implementation of any activity underPart B of the Project, enter into an agreement with the Participating Province, under terms substantially similar to those in themodel form of Framework Subsidiary Loan Agreement and under terms and conditions acceptable to the Bank.

Loan Agreement: Component 2 (Schedule 2, Section I.C (b)). The Borrower shall, prior to the implementation of any specificactivity under Part B of the Project for the benefit of a Participating Province, enter into a Subsidiary Loan Agreement with theParticipating Province under terms and conditions satisfactory to the Bank.

Loan Agreement: Institutional Arrangements (Schedule 2, Section I. A.2 (a)). The Borrower shall, through MAI’s DGPPSE, not laterthan three months after the Signature Date start design of a digital registry, operated and with a structure and mechanisms setforth in the Operational Manual, of beneficiaries of Part B of the Project.

Loan Agreement: Institutional Arrangements (Schedule 2, Section I. A.2 (b)). The Borrower shall, through MAI’s DGPPSE, as soon astechnically and operationally possible but not later than nine months after the Signature Date, start implementation of the digitalregistry of the beneficiaries of all Parts of the Project.

Loan Agreement: Operational Manual (Schedule 2, Section I.B). Description: The Borrower shall, through MAI’s DGPPSE, carry out theProject in accordance with a manual (the Operational Manual), acceptable to the Bank.

title.narrative: Farmers with access to improved infrastructure for agricultural risk mitigation and natural resources management
CSA technological packages acquired by farmers through matching grants (ANR)- Female
Farmers covered under an improved agricultural emergency mechanism- Female
Farmers reached with agricultural assets or services
Farmers with access to improved infrastructure for agricultural risk mitigation and natural resources management - Female
Farmers reached with agricultural assets or services - Female
CSA technological packages acquired by farmers through matching grants (ANR)
Users reporting satisfaction with key aspects of use and usefulness of agro-meteorological and market price information tools
New information tools for the management of agricultural price risk operational
Farmers covered under an improved agricultural emergency mechanism
Years digitized into an information platform for historical frequency of agricultural emergency events
Provincial-level integrated agriculture sector risk-management plans (PARMP) approved
Regional-level (inter-provincial) agriculture value-chain risk strategies (AVCRS) approved by the appropiate authority
Financial instruments for risk transfer for agricultural emergencies piloted
Public and private agrometeorological systems integrated into a single public access platform
Provinces contributing to an operative Single Registry for Agricultural Emergencies (RUPE)
